DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria MGMT Methylation Status Available Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient has tumor MGMT methylation status available.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria MGMT Methylation Assay Experimental Result Status Available
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._An assay to determine the pattern of methylation in the promoter of the MGMT gene. Aberrant methylation of the MGMT promoter is associated with squamous cell carcinoma._The outcome of an experiment or set of experiments, including observations and primary, processed, and analyzed data._A condition or state at a particular time._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: MGMT Methylation Assay Experimental Result Status Availability
Property.preferredDefinition: An assay to determine the pattern of methylation in the promoter of the MGMT gene. Aberrant methylation of the MGMT promoter is associated with squamous cell carcinoma.:The outcome of an experiment or set of experiments, including observations and primary, processed, and analyzed data.:A condition or state at a particular time.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: An assay to determine the pattern of methylation in the promoter of the MGMT gene. Aberrant methylation of the MGMT promoter is associated with squamous cell carcinoma.
The outcome of an experiment or set of experiments, including observations and primary, processed, and analyzed data.
A condition or state at a particular time.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ABTC-1402 study in Rave per request by R.Marasigan. mc 8/31/2015

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have availab
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have available tumor MGMT methylation status from routinely used methods for MGMT methylation testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Acceptable Routine MGMT Methylation Test Methods
ReferenceDocuments.description: Results of routinely used methods for MGMT methylation testing (e.g. MSPCR or quantitative PCR) are acceptable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1501 Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have readily available tumor MGMT methylation status from routinely used methods for MGMT methylation testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alt Question Text 1051
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have available tumor MGMT methylation status? Results of routinely used methods for MGMT methylation testing (e.g. MSPCR or quantitative PCR) are acceptable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1801 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have available MGMT methylation status?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1801 Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have available MGMT methylation testing?
